# Salvage
The [color=cyan]Salvage[/color] team works alongside Cargo to provide the station with its most important resource: **raw materials**. Salvage is responsible for pulling in wrecks with the [color=cyan]Salvage Magnet[/color], gathering ore and scrap during expeditions, and returning these materials to Cargo for processing.
Salvage work is dangerous, but with proper equipment and coordination, it becomes one of the station’s most essential and rewarding roles.
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Preparations
Salvage requires proper EVA gear, tools, and navigation equipment. All basic gear is provided in the Salvage Bay.
### Required EVA Setup
- [color=cyan]Spationaut Hardsuit[/color]: Provides pressure protection and an integrated helmet light. - [color=cyan]Magboots[/color]: Prevent drifting and slipping in zero-gravity. - Appropriate [color=cyan]Gas Tank[/color]: Oxygen or Nitrogen depending on species.
### Mining and Defense Salvage Specialists must be armed and prepared to gather materials.
- [color=cyan]Proto-Kinetic Accelerator[/color]: Infinite-ammo tool useful for both self-defense and light mining.
- [color=cyan]Pickaxe[/color]: Reliable mining tool and melee option. - [color=cyan]Ore Bag[/color]: Automatically collects nearby ore when worn on the belt.
### Useful Extra Equipment
- [color=cyan]Fire Extinguisher[/color]: Basic propulsion method in open space. - [color=cyan]Grappling Gun[/color]: Fast traversal tool with infinite shots. - [color=cyan]Salvage PDA[/color]: Comes with GPS software; note the station’s coordinates before leaving. - [color=cyan]Mass Scanner Computer[/color]: Shows wreck and debris positions; useful for planning.
Additional optional tools:
- [color=cyan]Handheld Radio[/color], [color=cyan]GPS[/color], and [color=cyan]Utility Belt[/color] help coordinate and organize salvage tasks.
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Salvage Magnet Pulls
The [color=cyan]Salvage Magnet[/color] lets Salvagers pull in: - Asteroids - Salvage Wrecks - Space Debris
Each pull lasts **6 minutes**. Anything left behind after this time disappears. Offers refresh every **3 minutes** if not accepted.
During a pull: - Fly to the grid - Gather ore, scrap, and components - Avoid hazards - Return materials to Cargo for processing
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Asteroids
Asteroids contain concentrated ore deposits and are usually safer than wrecks. Simply mine with your pickaxe, collect with your ore bag, and refine at the [color=cyan]Ore Processor[/color].
Watch out for: - [color=red]Gibtonite[/color] — volatile ore that explodes when disturbed.
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Space Debris
Space Debris contains: - Raw materials (steel, glass, plastic) - Machinery parts - Scrap and components
Hazards include: - [color=red]Space Carp[/color] - [color=red]Sharkminnows[/color] - Hidden [color=red]Landmines[/color]
Collected scrap should be fed into the department [color=cyan]Recycler[/color] for conversion into usable materials.
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Salvage Wrecks
Wrecks vary widely in danger and reward. Expect: - Damaged structure - Hostile creatures - Abandoned machines and equipment
Bring defensive gear, use your PKA to neutralize threats, and salvage machinery and metal for processing.
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Working With Cargo
Salvage and Cargo form one supply chain. Salvage gathers and returns resources — Cargo processes, stores, and distributes them.
Salvagers should: - Deliver ore promptly - Provide scrap for recycling - Return mechanical components for future fabrication - Communicate material needs with Cargo so lathes stay stocked
In turn, Cargo: - Refines ore into sheets - Prints components required for salvage gear upkeep - Maintains storage reserves for future pulls
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Advanced Support From Science
Science can manufacture improved equipment including: - [color=cyan]Mining Drills[/color] - [color=cyan]Mass Scanners[/color] - [color=cyan]PKA Upgrades[/color]
Science depends on Salvage for rare materials, and Salvage benefits from their research output.
-------------------------------------------------------------
## Large-Scale Salvage: The Mining Asteroid
The Mining Asteroid contains: - High-value ore - Dangerous fauna - Large cavern systems
Expect: - [color=cyan]Goliaths[/color] — heavy melee beasts - [color=cyan]Hivelords[/color] — ranged summoners - [color=cyan]Basilisks[/color] — freezing attackers
Only well-equipped, coordinated teams should attempt asteroid operations.
